    Introduction Comparison Maker Testing Assumptions

    ggls

    The goal of ggls is to add letter indicating the significance of differences of results among treatments displayed in ggplot barplots and boxplots.

    Installation

    You can install the development version of ggls from GitHub with:

    # install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("beabock/ggls")

    Example

    If you want to use the ggpubr package, you may need to create a list of comparisons for the groups you want to compare. If you want to compare all groups to each other, this command does that.

    library(ggls)

comparison_maker(ToothGrowth, supp)
#> [[1]]
#> [1] "OJ" "VC"

    Additionally, if you are using ggpubr, you may want to test the common assumptions of common statistical tests on your dataset. The test_assumptions function does this.

    
test_assumptions(ToothGrowth, supp, len)
#> [1] "Shapiro Test indicates non-normal distribution in the data"
#> [1] "Variance Test indicates equal variances in the data"
#>      Assumption          Decision
#> [1,] "Shapiro Normality" "Fail"  
#> [2,] "Levene Variance"   "Pass"

    You’ll still need to render README.Rmd regularly, to keep README.md up-to-date. devtools::build_readme() is handy for this.
